intro: Meum capillaceum, commonly known as the slender meadowfoam, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate yellow flowers and linear leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Meum capillaceum is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
